intro: Terminalia nigrovenulosa var. gracilior, commonly known as the slender African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by woody, elliptical fruits containing flat, seed-like structures. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
